{"step_by_step_thinking": "Binder syndrome, also known as maxillonasal dysplasia, is a rare congenital condition characterized by distinctive facial features. These include a flat nasal bridge and an acute naso-labial angle. It is also associated with Class III malocclusion, which is a type of misalignment of the teeth where the lower jaw protrudes forward. Class II malocclusion, on the other hand, is characterized by the upper jaw protruding forward, which is not a typical feature of Binder syndrome.", "answer_choice": "D. Class II malocclusion"}
